pinyin: zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ
english: the real intention is not in the wine

etymology.description: 醉翁 + 之 + 意 + 不在 + 酒 = the intention of the drunken old man is not in the wine.
etymology.interpretation: Used to say someone’s ostensible action is a pretext for another goal, i.e., their real intention lies elsewhere. Originates from Ouyang Xiu’s Zuiweng Ting Ji: “醉翁之意不在酒，在乎山水之间也.”

examples.chinese: 他请你喝酒(他請你喝酒)，其实是醉翁之意不在酒(其實是醉翁之意不在酒)，想拉你投资(想拉你投資)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qǐng nǐ hē jiǔ, qíshí shì zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ, xiǎng lā nǐ tóuzī.
examples.english: He’s inviting you to drink, but his real aim is to pull you into an investment.

examples.chinese: 记者的问题(記者的問題)醉翁之意不在酒(醉翁之意不在酒)，是想挖出丑闻(是想挖出醜聞)。
examples.pinyin: Jìzhě de wèntí zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ, shì xiǎng wā chū chǒuwén.
examples.english: The reporter’s question wasn’t really about the stated topic; it was meant to dig up a scandal.

examples.chinese: 他送礼给领导(他送禮給領導)，醉翁之意不在酒(醉翁之意不在酒)，是求个机会(是求個機會)。
examples.pinyin: Tā sòng lǐ gěi lǐngdǎo, zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ, shì qiú gè jīhuì.
examples.english: He gave a gift to the boss with an ulterior motive, hoping for an opportunity.
